info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 18 at 11:01AM EDT until April 21 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Marquette MI
info.description:
...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Michigan...
Sturgeon River near Alston affecting Houghton and Baraga Counties.
.Melting snow and releases from the Prickett Dam will result in river rises. The latest forecast shows the Sturgeon River at Alston reaching action stage but remaining below minor flood stage.
* WHAT...Elevated river levels caused by rain, snowmelt, and releases from the Prickett Dam continue.
* WHERE...Sturgeon River near Alston.
* WHEN...Until Monday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Homes and structures along the low lying areas and numerous roads become impacted by flood water. In Houghton County...Sturgeon River Road...Aho Road...and Rajala Road are impacted. In Baraga County...Sturgeon Road...Halonen Road and Usitalo Road are impacted. Along Froberg Road...Tahtinen Road... Irwin Road...Oliver Road...and Shirley Road are impacted.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EDT Friday the stage was 7.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 7.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 7.9 feet tomorrow morning. - Action stage is 7.5 feet. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette.
The next statement will be issued this evening at 1000 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY EVENING
